column9: Took this medication for about 10 years without any side effects.  About a year ago, I developed an annoying constant dry cough. Have changed medication and cough disappeared.

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: IT takes my blood pressure real low then after 4 hours or so pressure goes up. May go as low as 88/66 and up to 160 so i class it as ineffective.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
DT, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Took 20 mg for 1 year. Have only been able to get BP down to around 155/84. Made me so tired needed to take at bedtime.  I also always have some slight swelling of hands and around eye area.  Stopped taking and tried other BP meds but now back on Accupril as side effects on other BP Meds worse. Back to square 1 now.

column2: shortaphrodite, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had type 1 diabetes for over 37 years and my kidneys were leaking protein so my dr put me on Accupril.  Because I did'nt have high blood pressure, I had to take 2.5mg to start off with and now I'm on 5mg and don't think I am having any major hassles.  Have developed a cough that sometimes interferes with my eating and makes me a bit breathless.  Not too worried though.  I'm 41 and had a life expectancy of 10 so not doing too bad lol

column2: vince, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 80mg of accupril 2 aday when i wake up in the mon. bp is 160 over 80

column2: arduous1994, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Use HCTZ 25mg along with generic of Accupril (Quinapril) for years.  Started to not be enough. Increased Accupril and heart started fluttering (double beating). Stopped all meds for a week and BP went to 156/110. Started on HCTZ 25mg and Attenolol 25mg(had taken this before). Dropped to 140/97 with a 67 pulse. Added 5 MG of Quinapril to the mix and dropped to 122/84 but pulse dipped to 49. Not sure what to do now. Feel light headed, but relaxed.
